newsitem.title: CHINA: China bank says deposits top $247.5 bln by end-May.
newsitem.headline: China bank says deposits top $247.5 bln by end-May.

text.p: China's big state-run commercial bank, the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, saw its deposits top 2.055 trillion yuan ($247.5 billion) at the end of May, the official China Daily said on Saturday.
The bank had previously announced deposits stood at 1.8 trillion yuan as of the end of 1996.
Individual depositors accounted for 62 percent of this year's total with the remaining funds contributed by enterprises and institutions.
The bank's outstanding loans reached 1.8 trillion yuan by the end of last month compared with the previously reported 1.65 trillion at the end of 1996.
Most of the loans were to state companies and key projects, the newspaper said.
